description: From French hydraulique, from Latin hydraulicus, from Ancient Greek ὑδραυλικός (hudraulikós, “of a water organ”), from ὕδραυλις (húdraulis, “water organ”), from ὕδωρ (húdōr, “water”) +‎ αὐλός (aulós, “pipe”).

entries.meaning: Related to, or operated by, hydraulics.
examples: A hydraulic press is operated by the differential pressure of water on pistons of different dimensions.

verbs.description: hydraulic (third-person singular simple present hydraulics, present participle hydraulicking, simple past and past participle hydraulicked)

entries.meaning: (transitive) To mine using the technique of hydraulic mining.
